conclusion: The problem involves two cars, A and B, traveling in the same direction on a straight road. Their velocities over time are plotted in a graph. At t=30 seconds, they are side by side.
Velocity-time graphs show velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. The area under these graphs gives the displacement of the objects.
Car A has a horizontal line at 40 m/s, indicating a constant velocity of 40 meters per second after some time.
Car B has a straight line that starts at the origin and increases in velocity over time, suggesting it's accelerating at a constant rate.

premise: At t=30 seconds, they are side by side, meaning they've covered the same distance up to that point.
conclusion: The area under each graph up to t=30 seconds should be equal.

premise: Car A accelerates from 0 to 40 m/s in 10 seconds and then moves at a constant 40 m/s from t=10 seconds onward.
conclusion: Car A's displacement up to t=30 seconds is 1000 meters.

premise: Car B starts from rest and has a straight line up to t=30 seconds, indicating constant acceleration.
conclusion: Car B's displacement up to t=30 seconds is also 1000 meters.

Car A's displacement up to t=10 seconds is 200 meters.
conclusion: Car A's displacement at t=10 seconds is 200 meters.

conclusion: Car B's displacement at t=10 seconds is approximately 111.111 meters.
